title.rendered: 2 Terrifying Reasons to Use a Photo Vault App

content.rendered:
Everyone should have a photo vault app on their phone. Why? Because in a world where everyone lives online, you’re better off safe than sorry. In this article, we’ll touch on the top two reasons as to why you need a secure and trusted photo vault app installed on your Android device.

Prevent Smartphone Hacking

You should use a photo vault app because the chances of your photo gallery getting hacked will be lowered. Smartphone hacking is becoming more and more prevalent in 2020, which means the average smartphone user needs to be more aware and take the appropriate precautions. Most Android photo vault apps are free and safe & easy to use. 

The easiest way to make sure you’re not susceptible to being hacked is to check if your Android device is more than two years old. If your device is currently running on Android 7.0 Nougat, try updating by visiting Settings> System> Advanced System update.

By keeping your Android device updated to the latest version, you mitigate the risk of smartphone hackers tapping into your phone. Google frequently releases security updates with the most up to date security measures, so it’s important you stay up to date.

Also, in the worst case scenario, if someone does steal your phone, you add an extra layer of security to your most precious and/or private content. Avoiding leaked explicit photos is a concern to most people, and for good reason.

Keep your digital online presence protected by using amazing free tools like a photo vault app or a VPN.

Prevent Smartphone Snooping

The second reason you should use a photo vault app is avoid family, friends, acquaintances, etc. from poking their nose in your device. If you have kids that use your phone on a daily basis for example, it may be very easy for them to accidentally come across explicit content if you do have certain photos or videos lying around in your general photo gallery.

If you’re around a lot of people that could have access to your phone in any way whether it’s family, friends, overly-friendly co-workers, etc. it’s in your best interest to keep your personal life tucked away in an app that only you have access to.

Having a dedicated, passcode-locked safe space to store your private photo is a great way to ensure your device can be used by anyone, anytime.

If you’re ready to have your own dedicated, encrypted photo & video vault use Cover.
